definition: a way to make a living/a way to survive/a way out of a predicament
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
everything is unfamiliar

sentences.english: The master could do nothing but set both the slave and the lion free.
sentences.chinese: 主人莫可奈何，只好放了奴隶和狮子一条生路。

sentences.english: So William had to earn his own living.
But I cannot let you live , for I serve my master, Mundus.
sentences.chinese: 为了我的主人，我不会放你一条生路的。

sentences.english: Players are rewarded, ultimately, by letting them live.
sentences.chinese: 最终，放小女孩们一条生路的话，玩家会得到奖励。

sentences.english: Shoulder to shoulder, hand in hand, and complete your life journey.
sentences.chinese: 肩并肩，手挽手，共同走完这段人生路。

sentences.english: Life's long road, to seek, at heart, a sincere desire to live.
sentences.chinese: 漫漫人生路，上下求索，心中渴望真诚的生活。

sentences.english: Soar like a love song that stutters, life long, unsung.
sentences.chinese: 人生路漫漫，无名英雄，再唱一曲饶舌的情歌吧。
旖旎人生路，歌舞升平心。

sentences.english: Oh, calamity , is there no way out?
sentences.chinese: 噢大祸临头了这下可有生路？

sentences.english: Sometimes, a little duck, perhaps our life will be more exciting.
sentences.chinese: 有时，稍微低一下头，或许我们的人生路会更精彩。

sentences.english: Thee first step in the long life and safety.
sentences.chinese: 漫漫人生路，安全第一步。

sentences.english: When their parents died, the children had to shift for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在父母死后只好自谋生路。

sentences.english: In particular, agents were given the ability to find their way around an environment.
sentences.chinese: 特别是赋予作用者在某种环境自寻生路的能力。

sentences.english: Joanna bade her father good-bye and set off to make her fortune.
sentences.chinese: 乔安娜同父亲告别后，就动身自谋生路去了。

sentences.english: Wherever a man is, says I, a man can do for himself.
sentences.chinese: 要我说，人到哪儿都能自谋生路。

sentences.english: The boy was banished from the kingdom, cast into the wild world to fend for himself.
sentences.chinese: 把王子逐出家园，流放到荒野中自谋生路。

definition: through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
labor/physical work
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
desperate getaway (from a battlefield)/to cut a bloody path out of a battlefield
intact corpse/dead body with no parts missing
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
